class_notes: In this course students will read Sophocles' masterpiece Oedipus the King (Oedipus Turannos) in Greek. Classes will consist of students offering their prepared translations of passages of the Greek text into English, and explorations of the leading themes. We will read Sophocles' other remaining plays in translation. Discussions will turn on such topics as Sophocles' language; the poet's interest in fate and the limits on human agency; technical aspects of production and consumption in a play long regarded as the exemplary model of Greek tragedy; and the uses of Oedipus in 20th Century intellectual history.
course_description: Reading of one or more tragedies by Aeschylus, Sophocles, or Euripides, with attention to language, staging, and dramatic form and meaning.
